title: Revert is slower than close and reopen in Java editor
description: When using the Java editor, the 'Revert' option is significantly slower than the 'Close' and 'Reopen' options.
OB:
1. Answer 'no' to the 'Do you want to save changes' dialog.
2. Double click on the file in the navigator to reopen it.
3. Repeat steps 1 and 2.
4. Select 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor.
5. It takes 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original.
SR:
1. Open the Java editor.
2. Make changes to the file.
3. Reopen the file using the 'Close' and 'Reopen' options.
4. Note the speed at which the file is reopened.
5. Repeat steps 1-3.
6. Select 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor.
7. Note the time it takes for the file to revert to its original contents.
